title: Installation issue: gromacs
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install gromacs@2018.8
... 
==> Error: ChecksumError: sha256 checksum failed for /tmp/wachaandras/spack-stage/spack-stage-gromacs-2018.8-wo2lu6rdjzxevcype5dfruyeafvwbcsk/gromacs-2018.8.tar.gz
    Expected 3776923415df4bc78869d7f387c834141fdcda930b2e75be979dc59ecfa6ebec but got 776923415df4bc78869d7f387c834141fdcda930b2e75be979dc59ecfa6ebecf

/opt/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1083, in do_fetch:
       1080        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
       1081        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
       1082
  >>   1083        if checksum and self.version in self.versions:
       1084            self.stage.check()
       1085
       1086        self.stage.cache_local()

```

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux guinier.guinier 5.3.11-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT Tue, 12 Nov 2019 22:19:48 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Arch Linux
``` 

### Additional information

It seems that the sha256sum in the package.py file is incorrect:
In package.py:
'3776923415df4bc78869d7f387c834141fdcda930b2e75be979dc59ecfa6ebec'

Manually computed from the tarball downloaded directly from gromacs.org:
'776923415df4bc78869d7f387c834141fdcda930b2e75be979dc59ecfa6ebecf'

Fixing the package.py file should solve the problem.
